Project.name: PureMVC Standard Version for Java
Project.Description: PureMVC is a lightweight framework for creating applications based upon the classic Model-View-Controller design meta-pattern. This is the specific implementation for the Java language. See the Release Notes for this version for differences from the reference implementation.
Project.ReleaseNotes: Summary of Changes in 0.3 * Junit tests from Futurescale have been added. * build.xml file was refactored to make easier to build modules. * New Project Owner: Donald Stinchfield Summary of Changes in 0.2 * Current version is partially compatible with AS3 version 2.0.1 * Still needs onRegister/onRemove in Mediators and Proxies, and a few other things. * Added JavaDocs. * Contribution of original port by: Thomas Schuessler, Michael Watzek, Philipp Hemker, and Jan Grimmer
Project.Installation: Installing the Project Source Code * From the archive * Download the latest source code archive. * Unzip the source code zip to any folder on your disk. For instance: c:\development\ * You will see a PureMVC_Java_X_Y (where X_Y is version) source folder. For instance: c:\development\PureMVC_Java_X_Y * From the Repository * Use your favorite SVN client to retrieve the latest source code release from the repository.

Project.name: PureMVC Java Version Unit Tests
Project.Description: These are the unit tests for the PureMVC Standard Version for Java.
Project.Installation: Installing the Project Source Code From the archive * Download the latest source code archive. * Unzip the source code zip to any folder on your disk. * For instance: c:\development\ * You will see a PureMVC_Java_UnitTests_X_Y (where X_Y is version) source folder. * For instance: c:\development\PureMVC_Java_UnitTests_X_Y From the Repository * Use your favorite SVN client to retrieve the latest source code release from the repository.
